image.altText: A female police officer and three men dressed in orange SES overalls walk across dry land.

props.synopsis: Police are continuing to search for a four-year-old boy who vanished while playing in sand at his family's isolated sheep grazing property near Yunta in a remote part of South Australia's north.

title.children: Search continues for four-year-old boy who went missing in remote SA

image.altText: Chantelle has long dark hair and is wearing a blue jumper as she holds a tabby cat

props.synopsis: Just 12 hours after he was adopted, eight-month-old kitten Pierre was found in his carrier in the middle of the road, drenched after an overnight storm. Rescuers are urging owners to de-sex their cats, to help prevent other animals from enduring a similar ordeal.

title.children: Kitten rescuers 'in absolute shock' as newly adopted kitten dumped

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression stands in front of posters on a wall

props.synopsis: SA Police conducted more than 1,600 metal detector searches at Burnside Village at the weekend, but the state's Guardian for Children and Young People says officials need to "get the balance right" amid a crackdown on knife crime.

title.children: Youth guardian calls for balance amid SA knife crime crackdown

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. His family feel their pleas for licence reforms have been ignored by the state government.

title.children: Grieving family's anger at lack of licence reform amidst government 'buck-passing'

image.altText: Close up photo of a southern pygmy perch in a human hand.

props.synopsis: Information gleaned from tiny growth rings on "ear bones" of native pygmy perch could be the key to bringing them back from local extinction in the lower Murray.Â

title.children: Rings on 'ear stones' helping re-establish native pygmy fish

image.altText: A dolphin mid-air with water splashing under it

props.synopsis: The "completely preventable" death of a three-year-old dolphin in Adelaide's Port River has prompted new calls for mandatory propeller guards on boats entering the sanctuary.

title.children: 'A huge amount of sadness': Orphaned dolphin killed in Adelaide's Port River

image.altText: A woman with short, curly grey hair stands next to a box planter pouring water from a green watering can.

props.synopsis: Dead sea life washed ashore during SA's marine algal bloom has been diverted into commercial compost for farms and gardens, in what has been viewed as a small win amid the large-scale devastation.

title.children: Algal bloom sea casualties find new life in commercial compost

image.altText: Jesse Wardlaw shrugs and smiles as she celebrates a goal in an AFLW game.

props.synopsis: St Kilda outscores Port Adelaide 38-0 in the final quarter after trailing by 27 points at three-quarter-time, while Ally Anderson and Ebony Marinoff become the first players to feature in 100 AFLW games.

title.children: Saints pull off record comeback win as AFLW stars celebrate centuries

image.altText: A dark-coloured feral pig on some grass near a patch of mud.

props.synopsis: Dozens of pigs were released illegally over several attempts to establish populations for hunting, with a local landscape board warning of the danger a feral population could cause.

title.children: Feral pigs found in SA were imported illegally from NSW, testing shows

image.altText: An image of two men composited next to each other. They both wear suits. One has short dark hair, the other has grey.

props.synopsis: South Australia's algal bloom continues to cause political headaches for state and federal Labor. Perhaps that's why scientists are copping some of the flak now.

title.children: As algal bloom recriminations grow, politicians point to the scientists

image.altText: Steam engine crossing a railway bridge.

props.synopsis: Forget about being crammed on a suburban train, the real romance of rail is found through luxury long-distance inland trips or journeys back in time.

title.children: Australia's top rail journeys for tourists wanting to take it all in

image.altText: A woman and elderly man sitting at a table with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: A class action on behalf of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people alleges a Commonwealth Work for the Dole scheme was tougher on remote participants than on jobseekers in cities.

title.children: Class action against Work for the Dole alleges racial discrimination

image.altText: A nurse writes out a script.

props.synopsis: Qualified registered nurses will soon be able to write prescriptions for medications, in a bid to ease pressure on a stressed public healthcare system.

title.children: Can't get a GP appointment? A nurse could soon prescribe for you

image.altText: Optus graphic

props.synopsis: Analysts say the Optus CEO should "leave quietly" now or risk a more public exit once the reviews into the company's recent outages are complete.

title.children: The Optus triple-0 crisis has moved up a gear and all eyes are on one executive

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Yusuff Ali at an Australian produce exhibition in the UAE

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has invited Emirati 'hypermarket' chain LuLu Group to set up shop on Australia's shores and take on supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths.

title.children: PM invites Arab retail 'hypermarket' chain to take on Coles and Woolworths

image.altText: A five-year-old girl of South Asian background with pig tails pointing to a card held by a preschool educator.

props.synopsis: Despite the government wanting its Thriving Kids program for children with "mild to moderate" developmental delay and autism to start next year, the system is yet to be designed.

title.children: How will the NDIS alternative for some autistic kids work?

image.altText: A teenage boy being held by police officers on each arm being led to a divvy van.

props.synopsis: Police have charged two 16 and 17-year-old boys in relation to a dangerous incident involving an allegedly stolen car being driven into the pedestrian-only Bourke Street Mall.Â

title.children: Boys charged over brazen Bourke Street Mall incident

image.altText: The Moldovan and European Union flags unfurled over the facade of a multi-storey building.

props.synopsis: Moscow is accused of attempting to sway the election in favour of a pro-Russian party, but a majority of voters backed the pro-EU Party of Action and Solidarity.

title.children: Setback for Russia as pro-Europe party wins Moldova election

image.altText: Close up of Charlotte robot the World-First Robot for Lunar and Earth Construction

props.synopsis: Developers of a speedy, "spider-like" robot named Charlotte believe it could be building homes on Earth within years, and eventually further lunar exploration.

title.children: Robot that works at 'speed of 100 bricklayers' could soon be building homes

image.altText: A female pensioner holding her open purse in her hands.

props.synopsis: Women's super balances are disproportionately impacted by events later in life, in addition to childcare duties, which could mean serious financial problems, research from Super Members Council (SMC) has found.

title.children: Older Australian women could retire in poverty, new report says

image.altText: A man wearing a blue suit and red tie points his finger at something

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump initially threatened to impose such levies earlier in May but offered few details, leading to confusion among entertainment industry executives.

title.children: Trump says US will impose 100pc tariff on movies made outside the country

image.altText: a woman stands in front of two old gum trees which are fenced off, she is looking to her left and the sun is shining on her face

props.synopsis: Kylie Soanes says urban development should not come at the expense of nature and there's no reason why we should not spot a fairy wren on the way to the bus stop.

title.children: One woman's mission to rewild our cities

image.altText: Rick Morton, a man in his late 30s with stubble, smiles slightly, wearing a blazer and wire-framed glasses.

props.synopsis:
Journalist Rick Morton didn't want to write a book about Robodebt. Now that book, Mean Streak, has won the Prime Minister's Literary Award for non-fiction.

Â

title.children: Writing the book on Robodebt drove Rick Morton mad, but it won him $80k

image.altText: The EA Sports logo on a phone screen, with gaming title cover art seen in the background.

props.synopsis: A consortium of private equity companies, including one backed by Donald Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, is offering to take the video game giant private.

title.children: The Sims maker Electronic Arts bought for $80bn in record private equity buyout

image.altText: a pink pub with a sign saying 'larrimah hotel'

props.synopsis: The Larrimah Hotel sells to an Alice Springs businesswoman, after capturing the world's attention in podcasts and films about the disappearance 70-year-old Paddy Moriarty.

title.children: Owner sells outback pub shrouded in mystery after 70yo's disappearance

image.altText: Colouring pencils in a plastic container.

props.synopsis: A childcare centre in Sydney's south-west has been closed down immediately, with an investigation underway into concerns about children's safety.

title.children: Sydney child care shut down amid probe into alleged 'serious incidents'

image.altText: pills

props.synopsis: The TGA has urged patients to stop using unregulated melatonin products after testing revealed âsignificant discrepanciesâ between their actual melatonin amount and what was on the label.

title.children: Melatonin product has 400 per cent more than advertised, regulator warns

image.altText: twisted corrugated metal sheets and poles fall and lie on top of a dented red hatchback and cover grey car

props.synopsis: At least nine people have died after heavy rain and strong winds from the former Typhoon Bualoi flooded roads, knocked off roofs in central Vietnam, state media reported, with residents describing it as "one of the strongest".

title.children: At least nine dead after Typhoon Bualoi makes landfall in Vietnam

image.altText: Will Ashcroft of the Lions is presented the Norm Smith Medal

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions midfield star Will Ashcroft has added the AFL coaches' award for player of the finals to his growing list of accolades in the wake of his team's 47-point victory over the Geelong Cats on Saturday.

title.children: Ashcroft accolades grow after being named the best player of AFL finals

image.altText: Annette Brennan Lagi

props.synopsis: 47-year-old Stephen Fleming, who has pleaded guilty to manslaughter, is accused of ending his new housemate's life last year and stuffing the English teacher's body in a green waste bin.

title.children: Killer was 'extremely callous' in dumping victim's body

image.altText: (L-R) The Jks: A Comedy cast, Tiana Hogben, Kevin Hofbauer, Tom Ballard, Jordan Barr, Nicky Barry with director Ben Russell.

props.synopsis: Comedian Tom Ballard is swapping a stand-up stage for a dramatic one as his new stage show asks, how do you remember a divisive figure?

title.children: A problematic comedy legend dies. This new show explores what happens next

image.altText: A woman in a yellow-and-black striped jersey, holding a yellow football, is tackled from behind.

props.synopsis: Top-four aspirants Hawthorn are set to lose Emily Bates for the run towards the finals after the star midfielder suffered a shoulder injury.

title.children: Hawks lose captain ahead of run to AFLW finals

image.altText: An official removes the winners' trophy from the presentation area

props.synopsis: India T20 skipper Suryakumar Yadav has claimed that his team was denied the chance to lift the 2025 Asia Cup trophy, after it beat Pakistan in the final by five wickets on Sunday.

title.children: India claim they were denied Asia Cup trophy after win over Pakistan

image.altText: A young girl jumping on a mattress on a red dirt ground.

props.synopsis: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity, as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for the climate of today, let alone into the future.

title.children: These Australians are homeless with a house
